title: Bug 108822 - More efficient logic needed to process disk sorting when there is a border value for row value
OB: When sorting on disk, if sorting 40000 rows of data and setting the program to process data less than 40000, the current logic performs the following operations: 1.
SR: To reproduce this issue, follow these steps: 1. Sort 40000 rows of data on disk 2. Set the program to process data less than 40000 3. Save the file as temp file 4. Load the temp file into memory 5. Sort the data 6. Save the sorted data back to the temp file.
